body_html: Adding write_meta_graph=False fixed the error for me where saver.save would result in MemoryError on an Amazon GPU. But now I randomly get terminate called after throwing an instance of std::bad_alloc what(): std::bad_alloc Aborted (core dumped). I assume that the model is just too big and random fluctuations in memory use push it over the edge.

body: Adding `write_meta_graph=False` fixed the error for me where saver.save would result in `MemoryError` on an Amazon GPU. But now I randomly get `terminate called after throwing an instance of std::bad_alloc what(): std::bad_alloc Aborted (core dumped)`. I assume that the model is just too big and random fluctuations in memory use push it over the edge.
